Generation II.Gold: It has sharp, hard tusks and a rugged hide. Its Tackle is strong enough to knock down a house.
Generation II.Silver: The longer and bigger its tusks, the higher its rank in its herd. The tusks take long to grow.
Generation II.Crystal: Because this Pok é mon 's skin is so tough, a normal attack won't even leave a scratch on it.
Generation II.Stadium 2: It has sharp, hard tusks and a rugged hide. Its Tackle is strong enough to knock down a house. (Pokémon Red, Silver, or Crystal inserted) The longer and bigger its tusks, the higher its rank in its herd. The tusks take long to grow. (Pokémon Blue, Gold, or Yellow inserted)

Generation III.Ruby: Donphan 's favorite attack is curling its body into a ball, then charging at its foe while rolling at high speed. Once it starts rolling, this Pok é mon can't stop very easily.
Generation III.Sapphire: If Donphan were to tackle with its hard body, even a house could be destroyed. Using its massive strength, the Pok é mon helps clear rock and mud slides that block mountain trails.
Generation III.Emerald: A Donphan is so strong it can easily haul a dump truck. Its hide has toughened to a rock-hard state. An ordinary sort of attack won't even leave a scratch.
Generation III.FireRed: The longer and bigger its tusks, the higher its rank in its herd. The tusks take a long time to grow.
Generation III.LeafGreen: It has sharp, hard tusks and a rugged hide. Its Tackle is strong enough to knock down a house.

Generation IX.Scarlet: Donphan is covered in tough hide, so even being hit by a car won’t faze this Pokémon. However, it is extremely susceptible to rain.
Generation IX.Violet: Donphan is normally a calm Pokémon, but once it is enraged, it will curl its body into a ball and charge at you while rolling.
